quest.name: The Ladder
objectives: Speak with Urianger in Bottom Rung.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Ladder is situated to the north and west of Wright. Let us make our way there, Forename.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Ladder is a sturdy piece of engineering, but much may go wrong after twenty years of disuse. Let us be doubly thorough with its maintenance.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Bottom Rung, they call this place. How very apt.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Apparently, it used to be the control center for the Ladder and a bustling hub of transport. Its glory days are far behind it.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: First things first─a fifty-point inspection. Wouldn't do to have them falling to pieces, now!

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: ...Wh-Why are you standing there gawping? There's lots to be done, so go and make yourself useful!

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: To see my darling Chai so engrossed in his work... I think I'm falling in love again. <sigh>

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Forename, dost thou see yonder pair of Talos?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: For a blessing, they were found to be in good repair. Master Chai prepareth to activate them as we speak.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: With our arcane knowledge, Y'shtola and I will serve as his assistants. At the appointed hour, we shall imbue the golems with aether.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Others, meanwhile, attend to the Ladder itself, which hath too long lain neglected. Extensive maintenance will be needed ere it can move again, as well as myriad materials with which to perform it.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: If thou art willing, we would prevail upon thee to procure lumber.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: My thanks, Forename. Directly to the south thou wilt find a dry dock─Venmont Yards. Pray see if thou canst persuade the folk there to part with some lumber for our cause.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Venmont Yards lie directly to the south. Pray see if thou canst persuade the folk there to part with some lumber for our cause.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: Ho there, sinner. Haven't seen you around before. New to Gatetown, I take it. If you need lumber for a shack, you've come to the right place. We can do the building for you too, though that'll cost extra.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: ...You want lumber to restore the Ladder? Why in the world would anyone want to do that!?

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: If you don't have the coin, least you could do is come up with a believable excuse!

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: But look, I'm not one to turn folk away. I'll give you your lumber if you do me a favor in return.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: I'd just finished taking stock of our supply and was about to do another round for good measure. I want you to do the counting instead, and we'll see if your total matches mine.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: Now, some of the lumber's lying about the yard, but most of it is kept in the storehouse. For these, you can just ask Grithil for the number. Here, I'll lend you some writing material so you can take notes.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Take stock of the supply of lumber at the shipyard. What you learn can be reviewed in your key items.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: When you're done counting the lumber, come back here and we'll see if your total matches mine.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: Remember, for the stuff that's stowed in the storehouse, you can just ask Grithil for the number.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You count eleven planks in the stack.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You count twenty-four planks in the stack.

dialogue.name: GRITHIL
dialogue.text: Eh? Taking stock for Irvithe, are you?

dialogue.name: GRITHIL
dialogue.text: Well, last I counted, we had sixty-eight planks in the storehouse here.

dialogue.name: GRITHIL
dialogue.text: Nine of those were rotted through, though, so we tossed them out.

dialogue.name: CARPENTER03633
dialogue.text: Oi, Grithil, another load's just arrived.

dialogue.name: CARPENTER03633
dialogue.text: Thirteen planks all told, but one's damaged. It's only good for kindling now.

dialogue.name: GRITHIL
dialogue.text: Right, then. Bring the good ones here, and be sure to let Irvithe know as well.

dialogue.name: GRITHIL
dialogue.text: So, er...how many planks does that make now?

dialogue.name: GRITHIL
dialogue.text: Eh, you're writing down those numbers anyway, right? I'm sure you can work it out.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You jot down the details of the conversation.

dialogue.name: GRITHIL
dialogue.text: You're writing those numbers down, right? I'm sure you can work it out.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: What you learned can be reviewed in your key items.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: Done, are you? So, how many planks did you count?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: How many planks are there?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I need to check again.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: Eh? That sounds awful low. Reckon you should look at your notes again.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: Hmmm, seems to me you forgot the stacks lying outside. Why don't you take another look at your notes?

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: Ooh, close. Seems you haven't accounted for the planks that were delivered or thrown out. Might want to check your notes again.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: Aye, that's exactly what I counted!

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: Thanks for your help, friend. Taking stock fair puts me to sleep, but it has to be done. As promised, I'll give you your lumber. What do you need it for, anyway?

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: You were serious about the Ladder!? I'll be damned...

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: If that's the case, please let us help with the work!

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: We're shipwrights with no ships to build, only shacks. While it's a living, we all itch to do something greater.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: This fellow you say is in charge─you reckon he'd mind the likes of us barging in on his project?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: He won't mind.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: He'd welcome the help.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: Wonderful! I'll round up the lads and lasses and we'll head over to the Ladder─along with all the lumber you need!

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: Hmmm, that's on the high side by my reckoning. You sure you subtracted all the planks that weren't good?

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: Whoa, I don't think we have that many. Reckon you should take another look at your notes.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: We'll be along soon, and we'll bring all the lumber you need!

dialogue.name: GRITHIL
dialogue.text: Heh, some real work at last! It's been too long!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The work proceeds apace, I'm pleased to say. When it is restored, the Ladder will not only be our way forward; it will represent a momentous step towards lasting change for Kholusia.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I've rounded up as much material as I could for the work. Just my little bit for the cause.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The Eulmorans have rallied quite impressively. Amidst great adversity, a little purpose never goes astray.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename. I heard you went to find lumber.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: From afar, the Ladder looked like it was made entirely of metal, but there's actually a lot of wood if you look for it.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: By the intensity with which he works, 'tis as if all of that reluctance was a lie.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Hmph, such a primitive, inefficient design! A much smaller Talos from our company could just as easily perform the same task!

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: Oh, he'll have them moving again soon! I know he will!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ah, thou art returned. Wert thou able to procure the lumber?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Well, well, to secure not only the material, but the eager cooperation of the shipwrights besides. Their expertise shall greatly avail our efforts.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Master Chai's own efforts have not been without struggle, but he hath proven himself to be a determined soul. I doubt not but that the work shall be complete ere long, and we may continue on our way once more.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Though it hath been years in the making, at long last do the people stand united in defiance of the world's fate, their hopes spurring us ever onward towards journey's end.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Whatsoever may await us, when thou takest those final steps, I pray that it shall be with a smile upon thy face.
